attributes.action: Request for Buckinghamshire County Council to Turn On the Street Lights During Darkness on the A413.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since 2009 the overhead street lights on the A413 road between Chalfont St. Peter and Tatling End have not been in use during hours of darkness. 

The A413 is a dangerous stretch of road with a high accident rate, resulting in both serious and fatal collisions. A majority of this stretch of the A413 is fitted with street lighting, with the exception of the area between Tatling End and the railway viaduct.  

Between 1st January 1999 and 31st December 2003, 23 collisions were recorded on this small section of road alone, 11 of which were during hours of darkness, 8 of which were serious, and 2 fatal. 

Despite a safety review (www.buckscc.gov.uk) and the Council acknowledging that this is an area of concern, the street lights are now switched off during hours of darkness, presenting an avoidable increase in the risk to motorists, cyclists and pedestrians.

This Sunday (28/02/2010) during hours of darkness there was a further collision on this stretch of road, leaving 3 people with serious injuries and 1 in a critical condition.  Please help us to try and reduce these tragic events by turning back on our street lights.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Buckinghamshire County Council.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
